terrapeer.vui.j3dui.control
Class AbsoluteDragger

java.lang.Object
  terrapeer.vui.j3dui.control.AbsoluteDragger
public class AbsoluteDragger
extends java.lang.Object

A convenience class "dragger" with mouse and keyboard input and an InputDragTarget event output whose position is relative to the absolute source display space. If more than one source display is used, the same dragger configuration applies to all of them.

Typically, an absolute dragger is used as-is for WRM, or an absolute input drag filter is added to its output to establish a reference origin in the display space, such as for a widget in a control panel.

The event chain uses a mouse and keyboard drag sensor; connects the keyboard output to an absolute offset filter driven by the mouse for keyboard input reference; enables the two sensor outputs according to button and modifier conditions; connects those two filters to a drag enable filter used for drag canceling; and connects that filter to an input drag splitter as the event out.

Arrow keys are inherently a relative device. To use them as an absolute device the mouse is used to establish an absolute reference position by means of an input move sensor connected to an input offset filter that filters the arrow sensor output.

Constructor Detail

AbsoluteDragger

public AbsoluteDragger()
Constructs an AbsoluteDragger. For it to work, you must use addEventSource() to add a source display.

AbsoluteDragger

public AbsoluteDragger(javax.media.j3d.Canvas3D source,
                       InputDragTarget target)
Constructs an AbsoluteDragger with an event source and target.

Parameters:
source - Event and space source display. Null if none, but one must eventually be added.
target - Event target. Null if none.

AbsoluteDragger

public AbsoluteDragger(javax.media.j3d.Canvas3D source,
                       InputDragTarget target,
                       int mouseButtons,
                       int mouseModifiers,
                       int arrowModifiers)
Constructs an AbsoluteDragger with an event target and common parameters.

Parameters:
source - Event and space source display. Null if none, but one must eventually be added.
target - Event target. Null if none.
mouseButtons - Button flags (Input.BUTTON_???). Defaults to Input.BUTTON_ALL. If BUTTON_NONE or BUTTON_IGNORE, mouse dragging is disabled.
mouseModifiers - Modifier flags (Input.MODIFIER_???). Defaults to MODIFIER_ALL. If MODIFIER_IGNORE, mouse dragging is disabled.
arrowModifiers - Modifier flags (Input.MODIFIER_???). Defaults to MODIFIER_ALL. If MODIFIER_IGNORE, arrow dragging is disabled.
Method Detail

getEventOut

public InputDragSplitter getEventOut()
Gets the event output splitter. Use it to add and remove event targets.

Returns:
Reference to the event out splitter. Never null.

addEventSource

public void addEventSource(javax.media.j3d.Canvas3D source)
Adds a 3D display as an event source for this dragger, and sets capability bits of its view platform for use in intuitive mapping.

Parameters:
source - Event and space source display. Never null.

setMouseButtons

public void setMouseButtons(int buttons)
Sets the mouse buttons that enable mouse dragging.

setMouseModifiers

public void setMouseModifiers(int modifiers)
Sets the modifier keys that enable mouse dragging.

Parameters:
modifiers - Modifier flags (Input.MODIFIER_???). Defaults to MODIFIER_ALL. If MODIFIER_IGNORE, mouse dragging is disabled.

setArrowModifiers

public void setArrowModifiers(int modifiers)
Sets the modifier keys that enable arrow dragging.

Parameters:
modifiers - Modifier flags (Input.MODIFIER_???). Defaults to MODIFIER_ALL. If MODIFIER_IGNORE, arrow dragging is disabled.
